results.abstract: Gifts of that size are rare for universities. They’re even rarer for a public institution like Stony Brook, part of New York’s state university system.

results.title: California’s Snow Is Melting, and It’s a Beautiful Thing
results.abstract: After several brutal years of fighting drought, California finally got the water that it has so sorely needed.

media.caption: Water released from Hetch Hetchy Reservoir’s O’Shaughnessy Dam flows into the Tuolumne River. The reservoir currently supplies drinking water to 2.7 million San Francisco Bay Area residents.

results.title: Arizona Limits Construction Around Phoenix as Its Water Supply Dwindles
results.abstract: In what could be a glimpse of the future as climate change batters the West, officials ruled there’s not enough groundwater for projects already approved.

media.caption: Queen Creek, Ariz., a suburb of Phoenix, is projected to grow to 175,000 people from its current 75,000 — if it can find enough water.

results.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Trip Gabriel
results.title: Talk of Racism Proves Thorny for G.O.P. Candidates of Color
results.abstract: As candidates like Tim Scott and Nikki Haley bolster their biographies with stories of discrimination, they have often denied the existence of systemic racism in America while describing situations that sound just like it.

media.caption: Senator Tim Scott of South Carolina and Nikki Haley, who are both seeking the Republican nomination for president, have often spoken of discrimination and alienation they have experienced in the past.

results.abstract: A couple searched in East Harlem and the Bronx for a modest new apartment that would allow them to entertain friends and commute easily to Midtown. Here’s what they found.

media.caption: John Estep and Dante Olivia Smith searched for over a year for a one- or two-bedroom apartment in Upper Manhattan or the Bronx. The couple capped their budget at $250,000 and hoped to find something with a nice kitchen.
